item.title: cucumber set up
item.description: I recently wrote an integration test framework for a Kafka pipeline using Cucumber and Testcontainers. This is part 1 of a series explaining how, starting with setting up our project to be able to run Cucumber tests from maven & our IDE (IntelliJ in my case). why cucumber? I’d previously written a couple of integration test frameworks triggered from JUnit @Test methods. These both used fluent APIs to set up the required environment & execute the test, hiding the plumbing from the test author.

item.title: test your logging
item.description: I have yet to work on a project where we have attempted to test the log statements in the software & I’ve recently found myself asking why. item.title: about
item.description: This is my blog, codecrumbs. I’m a software developer specialising in Java with a particular interest in developer testing. I started blogging mainly to help me clarify my own thoughts and perhaps remember them beyond the end of the week. In the unlikely event that it benefits someone else, that’s great.
